wikipedia_page.main: Robert Bagguley (10 July 1873 – 8 October 1946) was an English first-class cricketer active 1891–1900 who played for Nottinghamshire. He was born in Ruddington; died in Bradmore. Bagguley was only 17 when he made his first-class debut for Nottinghamshire in 1891 and took six for 74 bowling against Sussex at Hove.

response: Bagguley was born in Ruddington, the son of Robert Bagguley, a stocking framework knitter and his wife Martha. Bagguley followed his father's occupation from a young age.British Census 1881
